ygData.subject: Re: Women on EQ: Flirting
ygData.msgSnippet: In another game I played (UO), I DID get married.  My RL paramour hated it.  I enjoyed the attention (yes, lack of romance in RL was probably a huge factor)
ygData.messageBody:
In another game I played (UO), I DID get married. My RL paramour hated it. I
enjoyed the attention (yes, lack of romance in RL was probably a huge factor)
and the pomp and circumstance and FUN of being able to be a medieval Lady with
her Lord. I actually dragged lots of people who were power gamers into my
little mental playground, and they have told me they are the better for the
experience. To this day, my online "husband" remains a friend, and he and I
talk about our significant others (his wife is expecting in July and I have the
baby present waiting to mail), the joys of parenthood, our respective fields,
and just, well, life. I do caution anyone that this experience isn't always
the case. I have had friends who have been less fortunate and hooked up with
some real psychos. On EQ I am not married. My wood elf is barely out of her
adolescence, and has some very protective guild brothers besides--which, by the
way, is LOTS of fun. She does have a hunting partner, and the two of them
together make Abbott and Costello look serious, but it's all in character. I
find it's safer, and easier on my real life relationship that way.

Sara, Povar

"Laura Chris Green, Ph.D." wrote:

> From: "Laura Chris Green, Ph.D." <cgreen@...>
>
> As a level 9 paladin, I have been flirted with some and responded some.
> Mostly all of us are kind of busy running around killing, buying and
> selling, etc. though. I enjoy the flirting perhaps because until maybe this
> year I had never done so in RL. When I was young (I'm 48 now) I thought I
> was ugly and I was too serious and intelligent to flirt or want to flirt.
> That was in the initial days of feminism when we rejected a lot of our
> feminity in the name of equality. Then for about 15 years I was way over
> weight and no one was interested for a long time. Recently I have lost 50
> lbs and become physically very attractive because of the weight loss and
> because I've learned how to enhance and appreciate my natural and innate
> beauty. Men respond at all levels including opening doors for me as well as
> actually coming on to me.
>
> Anyway, it's been fun in EQ getting some attention similar to that I now
> get in RL. On the other hand, I am fairly happily married (17 years now)
> and am not interested in having any affairs. On EQ that could only happen
> if I gave someone my real name and contact information, which I don't
> intend to do. I have found a steady, however, who is very nice and
> romantic, saying chivalrous things to me, giving me trinkets, and helping
> me find my corpse, fight, etc.. Like most women, my RL husband, is not and
> never has been romantic. Nor have any of the men in my life ever been. The
> rpg environment can lend itself to that chivalry, romantic thing so many
> of us fantasize about. I very much enjoy hearing his compliments as well as
> complimenting him. We usually do that when one of us needs to leave. It's a
> great way to end the game evening. I also have genuinely learned a lot from
> watching him play and playing with him. I suspect he's more experienced at
> EQ or role playing in general than I am and/or that he is a fairly mature
> person in real life. So my compliments are genuine, not just romantic
> frivolities.
>
> He's never asked me about my RL except to ask if I was really female. He
> doesn't know my age or marital status nor do I know anything about him.
> Wonder if it will ever come up or if we will continue to just interact
> within our game roles. Certainly I don't intend to bring it up.
>
> On Wednesday, June 16, 1999 12:48 PM, Heather Hire
> [SMTP:hrootbeer@...] wrote:
> > From: Heather Hire <hrootbeer@...>
> >
> > I'm throwing out a topic ladies, just want to see what experiences you
> > have had.....
> >
> > Flirting
> >
> > My character is the biggest flirt! I discovered early in the game that
> > most males (no matter what race) liked the look of my character, a
> > half-elf. Many flirted with her before she even knew she was cute. It
> > was in-character for Genneth (a bard) to flirt, so she is constantly
> > engaging in flirting.
> >
> > And to add to it, Genn has herself somewhat of a boyfriend in the game,
> > another member of her guild, Teban. ('Course she still flirts with
> > others, but he understands that she is mostly committed to him ;) So,
> > has this phenomenon hit anyone else? Do you get flirted with? Have
> > you found yourself a steady??
> >
> > Just curious
> >
